150_to_200_words:
Joe likes to use grapes to top his desserts because they are a sweet and tangy addition that can bring out the flavor of most desserts. Grapes are a great way to add a splash of color and texture to the plate. The sweetness of the grapes pairs well with the richness of desserts like ice cream, cakes, and pies. Grapes also provide a subtle yet bold contrast to the sweetness of the dessert, which adds complexity and balance to the dish.

Grapes are also a great way to add nutrition to desserts without overpowering the flavor. Grapes are a good source of antioxidants, which help protect against cell damage and aging. They are also a good source of vitamins, minerals, and fiber, making them a healthier option than other dessert toppings.

In addition to their nutritional benefits, grapes are incredibly versatile. They can be served fresh, dried, or frozen, and can be combined with many other ingredients to create delicious desserts. They can be added to yogurt, oatmeal, smoothies, and more. Grapes can also be used to make jams, jellies, and sauces to top desserts.
